article:
{{Infobox company| company_name = First Round Capital |

  company_logo =| company_type = Venture Capital | foundation = 2004 | location
  = Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
|
  industry = Venture Capital | assets = | homepage = [http://www.firstround.com/
  www.firstround.com] | num_employees = | }}

'First Round Capital' is a venture capital firm that specializes in providing
seed-stage funding to technology companies.

Managed by Josh Kopelman, [http://money.cnn.com/2007/10/09/technology/first-
_round_capital.fortune/ Well-Known Tech Investor Aims Higher, cnnmoney.com,
Semptember 7, 2007] Chris Fralic, Rob Hayes and Howard L. Morgan, the Philadelphia-
based company typically provides seed-stage investment that ranges from $250,000
to $500,000. {{Cite news |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2006/11/09/technology/-
09venture.html?pagewanted=1&_r=1&sq=first%20round%20capital&st=cse&scp=7
|title=For Start-Ups, Web Success on the Cheap |first=Miguel |last=Halft |date=2006-11-
09 |accessdate=2009-02-23 |publisher=New York Times}} The company seeks to
take an active role in the operations of the companies in which they invest,
often investing in pre-revenue companies. [http://angelsoft.net/angel-group/first-round-
capital ,"First Round Capital, Ideal Startup Investment", Angelsoft.net]
"We think of ourselves as baby-nurses, not baby-sitters," says Howard Morgan,
former professor at the Wharton School of Business, and partner at First Round
Capital. [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8uw3Ugt75HU, "Howard Morgan of
First Round Capital at a FundingPost event", Youtube, 2008]

Since its inception in 2004, First Round Capital has backed more than 70 companies, [http://www.crunchbase.com/financial-organization/first-round-
capital, "First Round Capital", CrunchBase, February, 2009] including Vid-
eoEgg, [http://www.businessweek.com/technology/content/sep2006/tc20060927_0-
13774.htm VideoEgg Gets a Jolt of VC, businessweek.com, September 27,
2006] Outright, [http://www.bizjournals.com/sanjose/stories/2009/11/1-
6/daily11.html Online bookkeeping startup Outright raises $5.5M] Yummly,
ScanScout, myYearbook, Knewton, Wikia, Yieldex [http://www.yieldex.com,
Yieldex.com, 2008] Jingle Networks, Odeo, LinkedIn, Eventful, Krugle,
Ambient Devices, The Climate Corporation, del.icio.us, IronPort, RockYou!,
SkillSlate, Solve Media,
Catchfree [http://www.firstround.com/portfolio/ First Round Capital
Portfolio] and several other firms. First Round Capital, while still in
its very early years, has already generated significant returns for its
investors from acquisitions such as StumbleUpon by eBay for $75
million [http://investor.ebay.com/releasedetail.cfm?releaseid=246467 eBay
press release] and Mint.com by Intuit for $170 million. [http://www.mint.com/press/intuit-to-acquire-mint-
com Mint.com press release]

For Christmas 2008, the company produced a video holiday
card [http://holiday.firstround.com/,"Happy Holidays from First Round
Capital", YouTube, 2008] in homage to the hit YouTube video "Where the
Hell is Matt? (2008)" [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zlfKdbWwruY, "Where
the Hell is Matt (2008)", YouTube, 2008] in which its portfolio company
executives were depicted dancing; the video became a viral hit. For its 2010
production, the firm created a series of YouTube videos spoofing the viral "Old
Spice" videos. [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kmjt02LMsLI "First Round
Capital 2010 Holiday Card", YouTube, 2010]

In 2010, the company was ranked the third-largest venture-capital investor in
the United States, as measured by the number of deals. http://www.philly.co-
m/inquirer/business/20100825_PhillyDeals__First_Round_Capital_ranks_high_in_num-
ber_of_deals.html

In September 2012, First Round moved its headquarters from suburban
Conshohocken, Pennsylvania to University City, Philadelphia. http://technicallyphilly.com/2012/08/15/first-round-capital-
to-relocate-hq-to-university-city-from-conshohocken-in-september
